Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Instrument_Host_PDS3.instrument_host_desc:
Instrument Host Overview ======================== The Mauna Kea Observatories are located at an altitude of 4,200 meters, near the summit of Mauna Kea on the island of Hawaii, the largest of the Hawaiian Islands. The following telescopes are in operation at the observatory.
Telescope (ID): size: Sponsors:
UH 0.6-m Telescope (UH06M) 0.6 m U Hawaii UH 2.2-m Telescope (UH22M) 2.2 m U Hawaii/NASA NASA Infrared Telescope Facility (IRTF) 3.0 m NASA Canada-France-Hawaii Telescope (CFHT) 3.6 m Canada/France/UH United Kingdom Infrared Telescope (UKIRT) 3.8 m United Kingdom W. M. Keck Observatory (KECKI) 10.0 m Caltech/U Cal W. M. Keck Observatory (KECKII) 10.0 m Caltech/U Cal Subaru (JNLT) 8.0 m Japan Gemini Northern 8-m Telescope (GEMN) 8.0 m USA/UK/Argentina/ Canada/Brazil/Chile Caltech Submillimeter Observatory (CSO) 10.4 m Caltech/NSF James Clerk Maxwell Telescope (JCMT) 15.0 m UK/Canada/Netherl Submillimeter Array (SA) 8 x 6.0 m SAO/Taiwan Very Long Baseline Array (VLBA) 25.0 m NRAO/AUI/NSF
